title: How a lesson from Randy Moss helped Patriots WR coach win Stefon Diggs’s trust
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Diggs admitted that he doesn't trust many people.
Todd Downing, he said, is one of them.
Stefon Diggs Matthew J.

title: Police continue search for Gardner man accused of killing wife in 2023
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime More than two years ago, Aaron Pennington allegedly murdered his wife at home in Gardner and vanished.
Gardner resident Aaron Pennington, 35, is wanted for murder in connection with his wife's death.

Worcester County District Attorney's Office By Abby Patkin November 20, 2025 | 4:32 PM 1 minute to read Authorities reignited their manhunt for Aaron Pennington on Thursday, more than two years after the Air Force veteran allegedly murdered his wife at home in Gardner and promptly vanished.

title: Smithfield football families stand by their kids amid antisemitism claims
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Parents argue that a recent presentation by Jewish organizations overstepped privacy boundaries.
A message projected on the side of Smithfield High School before a School Committee meeting about a report of antisemitic hazing on the football team.

Edward Fitzpatrick/The Boston Globe Parents of Smithfield High School football players accused of antisemitic hazing filed a complaint with the state Education Department, denying the allegations and saying a school presentation by local Jewish groups violated their children’s privacy, putting the students at risk.

title: Stephen A. Smith claps back, calls Drake Maye a ‘liar’ over Cam Newton comments
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "Don't tell me that you're an athlete and you don't know that Cam Newton is on this show.
You're lying.
" Drake Maye speaks to reporters after a game against the Atlanta Falcons, Sunday, Nov.

title: More than 400 trans flags removed from Boston Common; advocates call for hate crime investigation
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News “It’s discouraging that we can’t celebrate our dead, and especially this week,” an organizer who helped place the flags said.
“It’s heartbreaking to see that here.
” A transgender flag flies next to the Massachusetts state flag in front of Boston City Hall in 2016.

title: Traveling with a group? A lodge in Vermont and seaside cottages in Maine stand out, according to Good Housekeeping
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel They were recognized in the Good Housekeeping 2026 Travel Awards.
The Dunes on the Waterfront in Ogunquit, Maine.

The Dunes on the Waterfront By Kristi Palma November 20, 2025 | 2:14 PM 1 minute to read Those eyeing group travel in 2026 can book two outstanding getaways in New England, one on the beach and one in the mountains, according to Good Housekeeping.

title: Thanksgiving 2025 in Greater Boston: What’s open for dine-in and takeout

bullets: Food Reservations are getting taken and takeout forms are closing soon, so act fast.

title: Why is the delivery fee so high on electric and gas bills?

title: Review: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo shine, but ‘Wicked: For Good’ can’t escape its original sin
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Movie Reviews "Wicked: For Good" has moments of brilliance, but it should never have been made into a standalone movie in the first place.
Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo in “Wicked: For Good.
